page.title: 12HARTHILL SCHOOL
page.content: Harthill-with-Woodall School was opened on May 13th 1878; its first Headmaster was Mr John Henry Kilburn, and it was governed by the Harthill-with-Woodall School Board, whose name is carved in the stonework of the main school building. Originally the school had three separate departments, for Boys, Girls, and Infants, and Log Books still exist recording the daily life of the school from its opening day. The school eventually came under the control of the West Riding County Council and then, in 1974, under that of Rotherham Borough Council. It is, of course, now a Junior and Infant School. At present (July,1985) there are 160 children aged from 5 to 11 in the school, arranged in six classes. At 11 the children go to Wales Comprehensive School which is about 3 miles away.
